meanings.definition: A regular payment made during a person's retirement from an investment fund to which that person or their employer has contributed during their working life.
meanings.sent1: Many people rely on pensions to support them after they stop working.
meanings.sent2: My grandfather receives a pension every month now that he's retired.
meanings.sent3: The pension check arrived just in time for Grandma to treat us to ice cream.
meanings.sent4: Her pension was like a warm blanket on a cold winter night, comforting and secure.
meanings.sent5: The idea of pensions is like planting seeds in your youth to harvest in old age.

meanings.definition: Dismiss someone from employment with a pension.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to pensions the long-serving employees to make room for new hires.
meanings.sent2: After years of service, the boss pensions off the loyal secretary with a farewell party.
meanings.sent3: It was a bittersweet moment when they chose to pensions the veteran employee on his birthday.
meanings.sent4: The manager had to pensions the senior staff member due to budget cuts.
meanings.sent5: To pensions someone is to bid farewell with gratitude and a promise of support.
